intro: Pilosella blyttiana subsp. chrysochroa, commonly known as the golden pilosella, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually basal, with a woolly or hairy texture, providing a distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
